meanings.definition: Faciends (noun): plural form of faciend, something that must be done or attended to
meanings.sent1: Completing all the faciends on her list made her feel accomplished.
meanings.sent2: The students had many faciends to finish before the end of the school day.
meanings.sent3: The faciends of cleaning their rooms seemed never-ending to the children.
meanings.sent4: The faciends of daily chores weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The faciends of studying for the exam loomed over her like a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: Faciends (verb): third person present form of faciend, to do or attend to something
meanings.sent1: She faciends her responsibilities diligently every day.
meanings.sent2: He faciends his work with dedication and focus.
meanings.sent3: The cat faciends grooming itself meticulously.
meanings.sent4: The sun faciends shining brightly in the sky every morning.
meanings.sent5: The river faciends flowing gracefully towards the sea.
